comment: He was a fair grader and really cared for his students. The test are tough but as long as you showed up to the breakout sessions and did the work you will do fine.

He's a great professor but you have to put in the work. GO TO HIS BREAKOUT SESSIONS, they're what saved me. He tells you what to study on the test and he gives extra credit. He drops the lowest quiz and takes an average of the rest, and replaces your lowest exam with the final. he also allows a formula sheet for all tests. tests are easy questions
The class itself wasn't so hard. He explains things step by step and comes by to make sure we understand what we are doing.

Abebe's phys lab was really easy, but a lot of the time the machinery kept breaking and he didn't know how to fix it, and a lot of the time didn't seem to know what we were doing in lab. This can be frustrating considering some experiments are short but take a long time because of this. This lab is exceptionally easy though, and he's nice enough.

Attendance is not mandatory but he mentions extra credit opportunities during class and in breakout sessions. Also tells you exactly what to know for the test in lecture and allows you make a formula sheet. Tests are 15 questions in class the lowest is dropped and quizzes are 5 questions in d2l no lockdown. Homework is easy.

Very nice guy. Attendance is not mandatory but HIGHLY recommended. Unless you just really good as physics.. Homework is short and he will re open it if you ask. He assigns a short quiz (like 5 questions not lockdown) before his tests, and the actual tests are like 15 questions. Go to breakout sessions for extra credit opportunities!

GO TO HIS STUDIOS. The people giving bad reviews are salty af that they don't show up to the studio they enrolled in, where the teacher literally explains test questions. There's homework too but you can look it up. I ended taking this guy for phys 2212 the following semester.

Awful. Avoid at all costs. Having this professor was like not having one at all. He provided nothing on his D2L to help, only blank lecture notes with no work, nor answers to help. If you have this professor, be ready to teach yourself everything. Count on this professor to be of little to no help.

If you can get past a somewhat heavy accent, he is great. He goes over everything in detail and explains every logical step and assumption when solving a problem. The breakout sessions is just solving some example problems. You have to take a lot of notes in class and he works very fast. Take good notes and pay attention and it is fairly easy.

Really enjoying Dr. Abebe's class. Gives a quiz (online) before every test, always super easy. About 8 homework questions per chapter (online) and always easy to figure out. Best part is that on tests he lets us bring a cheat sheet (double sided) to use, whatever we can fit on it. His test questions are simple and similar to the practice problems.

I took him for 2211 Lab summer. The grade is basically 11 labs combined. He drops the lowest lab grade at the end. I know he's a lenient grader because I know some labs my calculations are absolutely wrong and I still get an A on all my labs. Idk if hes is lenient because this is a summer class, but he was def good to us. 100% recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: As the other students have said, please don't take this professor. He is very lecture heavy and he writes really small on the whiteboard with the lightest colored markers. He sucks at communication as he will take days to reply to emails. The breakout sessions do not help in anyway besides making you complete a so called "study guide" for the exam.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Please don't take this professor, he writes so small on the whiteboard and assumes everyone understands the difficult content. There's no room for negotiating incorrectly marked tests and he has a bit of a temper. He comes off as nice but don't be fooled, he's pretty rude and loves to put blame on the class than accept fault.

You can show up to the breakout sessions all you was but it doesn't help with exams. Even though he drops the lowest test grade, he barely goes over content that'll be on the test. He's very hard to talk to because he catches an attitude when he doesn't understand your question. He blames the class for failing and barely takes fault.

Please look for other professors. I have always been a big fan of phys in high school and in college until I took his class. He has very hard tests and expects you to put in all the effort you have just into his one class while you are taking a full semester. If you do take his class breakout seasons are key to passing the test or you will fail.

do not take this class with this professor. this is the worst professor i have ever had. first of all he is terrible when trying to communicate with him because he might answer in 4-5 days. he blames the students for him not putting in the work for this class instead of him just teaching the material. the tests were over info he never went over

Just your basic boring physics lab. He will help you out if you have trouble with the lab: he is a nice professor. Also, I feel like the major part of each lab is completion so it was not too difficult to pass them.
